title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement adam.sparks@curtine.edu.au. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to {rippo}
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See {tidyverse} guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to {rippo}
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("AAGI-AUS/rippo", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to {rippo}
text: use air format code style. please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to {rippo}
text: Please note {rippo} project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Simplify AAGI-CU IPPO Register Updates
text: goal {rippo} ease data entry tracking AAGI-CU Intellectual Property Project Outputs (IPPO) reporting purposes.

text: {rippo} available R-Universe pre-built binaries (easy way). get started:

title: Simplify AAGI-CU IPPO Register Updates
code: o <- options() # store default options  options(pkg.build_vignettes = TRUE)  if (!require("pak"))   install.packages("pak") pak::pak("AAGI-AUS/rippo")  options(o) # reset options

what: Using {rippo} for generating your project IPPO reports
title: Simplify AAGI-CU IPPO Register Updates
text: {rippo} includes Shiny web app make interfacing IPPO tables simpler. {rippo} installed can run web app like : app currently following features: Add background IP specifying relevant details, Add background IP catalog frequently-used IP, Add outputs specify links outputs background IP, Add correspondence related outputs, Load existing IPPO registry, Edit delete existing entries, Export resulting IPPO .xlsx format.

Dates expected formatted date objects Excel. stored text () data types, may cause issues upon loading. links outputs background IP expected come Table X, Lines Y X relevant table Y list corresponding rows table. default app save list comma separated integers (e.g., Table 1, Lines 1,2,3,4,8), however purposes reading files recognise collapsed lists using colons hyphens (e.g., Table 1 Lines 1:4, 8 Table 1 Lines 1-4, 8). ways specifying list identified.

what: Using {rippo} for generating whole IPPO registers for reporting
title: Simplify AAGI-CU IPPO Register Updates
text: {rippo} includes two functions used generate unified Word document IPPO. list_ippo_tables() create_ippo_report(). former, list_ippo_tables(), creates nested list object IPPO tables project ordered project code Tables 1-5 (excluding tables data entries). latter, create_ippo_report(), takes nested list IPPO tables generates MS Word document output reporting GRDC. function allows providing existing MS Word document appending values . useful , case Curtin, overarching IPPO register exists AAGI-CU project IP outputs fall service support projects, upskilling awareness projects research development activities. overarching document can read remainder individual project IPPO details can read appended project order saved GRDC Box folder reporting like .
code: # for macOS with GRDC Box synced locally library(fs) sp <- "CU" # strategic partner for report R_drive <- "/Volumes/dmp/A-J/AAGI_CCDM_CBADA-GIBBEM-SE21982/" ippo_doc <- "~/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/AAGI-GRDC/AAGI IPPO Register/AAGI-CU-IPPO Register.docx"  tl <- list_ippo_tables(    dir_path_in = path(R_drive, "Projects"),    sp = sp  )  create_ippo_report(tables_list = tl,                    infile = ippo_doc,                    outfile = ippo_doc,                    sp = sp)

title: Create an IPPO register report for GRDC — create_ippo_report
Create an IPPO register report for GRDC — create_ippo_report
text: tables_list nested list IPPO register data tables AAGI service support research development projects reporting generated list_ippo_tables(). sp character string providing AAGI strategic partner generating report, can full name two letter string used AAGI. outfile filename including file path file written. output file MS Word(TM) document follows AAGI style guidelines.

title: Create an IPPO register report for GRDC — create_ippo_report
text: invisible NULL, called side-effects generating MS Word(TM) document tables report project's IPPO.

title: Create an IPPO register report for GRDC — create_ippo_report
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()   # for macOS  library(fs)  sp <- "CU" # strategic partner for report  R_drive <- "/Volumes/dmp/A-J/AAGI_CCDM_CBADA-GIBBEM-SE21982/"  tl <- list_ippo_tables(    dir_path_in = path(R_drive, "Projects"),    sp = sp  ) create_ippo_report(tables_list = tl,                    sp = sp,                    outfile = "~/AAGI-CU-IPPO-register.docx"                    ) }

what: Create a Table of Third Party IP (Table 3) of the R packages used for an AAGI IPPO document — create_table_3
title: Create a Table of Third Party IP (Table 3) of the R packages used for an AAGI IPPO document — create_table_3
text: Automatically recognises R packages used project generates Table 3 IPPO register.  allowances non-CRAN packages, ASReml-R DiGGer also Quarto software.

title: Create a Table of Third Party IP (Table 3) of the R packages used for an AAGI IPPO document — create_table_3
code: create_table_3(   project_path = getwd(),   outfile = "1 documentation/table_3.csv",   aagi_project_code = "AAGI-ALL-SP-003",   quarto = FALSE,   digger = FALSE,   asreml = FALSE )

title: Create a Table of Third Party IP (Table 3) of the R packages used for an AAGI IPPO document — create_table_3
text: project_path path directory project generate tables , defaults current working directory recurses subfolders. outfile Character string provides file name full path directory table saved. Defaults current project's “1 Documentation” directory filename “table_3.csv”. aagi_project_code AAGI project code inserted table.  Defaults current Service Support project code within AAGI project.  Note project serviced code within AAGI project allocated Service Support, e.g. "AAGI--SP-003". quarto Boolean cite Quarto software? Defaults FALSE. digger Boolean cite DiGGer package? Defaults FALSE. asreml Boolean cite ASReml-R package? Defaults FALSE.

title: Create a Table of Third Party IP (Table 3) of the R packages used for an AAGI IPPO document — create_table_3

title: Create IPPO tables list — list_ippo_tables
text: Traverses directories imports IPPO register Excel(TM) workbook files creates list tables corresponding Tables 1-5 AAGI IPPO register AAGI-CU Service Support projects.

title: Create IPPO tables list — list_ippo_tables
text: dir_path_in string value provides path top-level directory R: drive holding AAGI-CU Service Support project files. sp character string providing AAGI strategic partner generating report, can full name two letter string used AAGI.

title: Create IPPO tables list — list_ippo_tables
text: list object contains tables IPPO registers organised AAGI Service Support project AAGI R&D Activity.

title: Create IPPO tables list — list_ippo_tables
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  # for macOS  library(fs)  R_drive <- "/Volumes/dmp/A-J/AAGI_CCDM_CBADA-GIBBEM-SE21982/"  list_ippo_tables(    dir_path_in = path(R_drive, "Projects"),    sp = "CU"  ) }
